answers.text: countries with the smallest per capita incomes

qas.question: These countries rely on foreign aid for what?
In Sub-Saharan African countries, what level of government is corruption especially prevalent at?
How many funds did not reach their intended recipients who needed medical attention?

context: Corruption is often most evident in <a0_0>countries with the smallest per capita incomes<a0_0/>, relying on foreign aid for <a1_0>health services<a1_0/>. <a2_0>Local<a2_0/> political interception of donated money from overseas is especially prevalent in Sub-Saharan African nations, where it was reported in <a3_0>the 2006 World Bank Report<a3_0/> that <a4_0>about half<a4_0/> of the funds that were donated for health usages were never invested into the health sectors or given to those needing medical attention.
